mdRecord.dcterms:description: This is a paper, "Architecture Project: The Appalachia Pickin' Parlor," written by a student, Anthony M. Murray, for the Architecture 107 course taught by Prof. Pamela Hemenway Simpson in Spring term 1974. There is a handwritten note on the front which identifies this as Copy 4 of the paper and intended for Mrs. Wood -- probably Nannie Walker Wood.
There is a copy of this paper in Collection 0294 -- Walker-Wood Family Papers, 1910-1975.
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Architecture Project: The Appalachia Pickin' Parlor, 1974
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture
Virginia -- Lexington
